ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No, the truth is we are destitute!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: No. In fact we have been deprived of it."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (No, we are not lost.) In fact, we have been deprived of everything".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay! we are made to suffer privation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: nay, rather we have been robbed!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Aye! it is we who are deprived!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: ‘No, it is we who have been deprived!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Indeed we are shut out (of the fruits of our labour)!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (Then they said): "Nay! Indeed we are deprived of (the fruits)!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: No, rather, we have been prevented'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:27] ‘Nay, but we have been deprived!’, of its fruits, by our denying it to the poor folk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Then they said: (Nay, but we are desolate!) We have been denied the benefit of the garden because of our ill intentions.
